#Text=Benelux
#Text=Benelux is an economic union comprising three neighbouring monarchies : Be lgium , the Ne therlands , and Lux embourg .
#Text=The name is formed from the beginning of each country 's name .
#Text=It was a precursor of the European Union .
#Text=Cities
#Text=— traveller magnet due to its impressive architecture , lovely canals ( grachten ) , museums and liberal attitudes
#Text=— a giant cathedral , medieval streets , artistic heritage , and the second-largest port of Europe , coined the Diamond of the Sea
#Text=— unofficial capital of the EU with a nice historic centre and several museums
#Text=— one of Europe 's wealthiest cities in the 14th century , its large and beautiful historic centre remains intact ; a romantic city with pre-Renaissance walls
#Text=— largest city of Wallonia ( the French part of Belgium ) , along a wide river , industrial cityscape with hiking and resorts in the nearby hills
#Text=— its spectacular valleys and plateaus led it to be nicknamed the " Gibraltar of the North "
#Text=— modern architecture , good nightlife and the largest port of Europe , Rotterdam is a hub of excitement
#Text=— seat of government , royal family , judicial capital of the world and Madurodam
#Text=— historic centre , nice antique stores and the Rietveld-Schröder House are all in this magnificent Dutch city
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=— The most sparsely populated in Benelux , this is a hilly countryside region covered with forests .
#Text=—
#Text=For three days in February , the town is transported back to the 16th century for one of the most fantastic carnival festivals .
#Text=— Largest national park with heathlands , sand dunes and woodlands .
#Text=—
#Text=Millions of tourists visit the tulip fields each Spring .
#Text=—
#Text=These windmills show the typical Dutch landscape in all its glory .
#Text=—
#Text=An area of green fields and small villages , some of which have been portrayed by artists such as Pieter Bruegel .
#Text=—
#Text=Old island evacuated in 1859 , a well-preserved ghost village remains .
#Text=—
#Text=Quaint small town presided over by a rather splendid château .
#Text=—
#Text=The Waterloo Battlefield where Napoleon lost the final battle that changed Europe 's face forever .
#Text=Understand

#Text=Luxembourg and the East of Belgium are a hilly area , but the rest of the Benelux is what is known as the Low Countries ; this is the delta of the rivers Scheldt , Meuse , Rhine and Ems that used to be swamp land .

#Text=Enterprising fishermen discovered a flair for trade when trading routes started to emerge between the grain markets of the Baltic Sea and the renaissance-bitten luxury goods markets of northern Italy .
#Text=Here is where stocks were invented .

#Text=Trade in all kinds of goods as well as enslaved humans made a small elite incredibly rich and the Dutch East India Company ( VOC for its Dutch name ) became one of the first multinational stock based companies and in its heyday controlled entire countries .
#Text=This attention to trade made Bruges one of the largest cities in Europe in its day , and the medieval old town is still well preserved .

#Text=When the secession war with Spain progressed , French and Flemish alike fled to Amsterdam , which became the new world capital of trade , which is still witnessed in the many ' Houses of the Lords ' lining the famous canals .
#Text=Talk

#Text=Dutch is the main language in the Netherlands and in the north of Belgium ( Flanders ) where it is also known as Flemish , and is also one of the two official languages of Brussels , spoken by about 15 % of its inhabitants .

#Text=French is the main language ( 85 % ) in Brussels , and in all of the South of Belgium ( Wallonia ) with the exception of the eastern side of Wallonia where you will find the Belgian German speaking community .
#Text=In Belgium , while most Dutch speakers can speak reasonable French , few Belgian francophones speak Dutch , which has caused political tension in the country .
#Text=Luxembourg has three official languages : Luxembourgish , French and German , but for all practical purposes French is the most important language for travelers .
#Text=Many people , especially in the Netherlands and Flanders , the Dutch-speaking part of Belgium , have a very high proficiency of English , and younger people often have near native fluency .
#Text=This is because foreign television content is aired in its original language , with subtitles .
#Text=On the other hand , in French-speaking Wallonia , TV is dubbed into French and people hence do not speak English so well .
#Text=Frisian is a minority language spoken in Friesland ( Netherlands ) .

#Text=As Dutch is very close to German , you will be understood with difficulty by most Dutch speakers if you speak German , but not all of them will necessarily speak more than a handful of German phrases themselves .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Most people get into the Benelux region by plane or train .
#Text=Schiphol Airport in Amsterdam and Zaventem Airport in Brussels are the largest airports in the region ; Schiphol is also important as a transfer airport for further destinations in Europe .

#Text=Smaller airports are present in Antwerp , Eindhoven , Groningen , Luxembourg , Maastricht , Charleroi ( " Brussels South " ) , Liège and Rotterdam , which are mostly used by no-frills airlines .
#Text=By train
#Text=High-speed rail networks connect the Benelux with France , Germany , and the United Kingdom ( through the Channel Tunnel ) .
#Text=High-speed trains operated by Thalys connect Paris with Brussels , Antwerp , Rotterdam , and Amsterdam in a little more than three hours .

#Text=High-speed ( and slower intercity ) ICE International trains operated by Deutsche Bahn ( and Nederlandse Spoorwegen ) connect Frankfurt ( and Cologne ) with Amsterdam and Brussels , and Basel with Amsterdam .
#Text=High-speed trains operated by Eurostar connect London with Brussels .
#Text=By bus
#Text=The major companies running Intercity buses in Germany all serve stations in the Benelux as well .
#Text=France liberalized its long distance bus market in 2015 , and connections to major cities in the Benelux have either been announced or are planned .
#Text=Some buses even take you to London , either through the Channel Tunnel or by being loaded on a car ferry .
#Text=Get around
#Text=As this is a densely populated area in Europe you usually have the choice of several modes of transport and getting around should be a breeze , if sometimes a bit hard on the wallet .
